Award.AbstractNarration: The Symposium on Computational Geometry (SOCG) is the premiere international conference in computational geometry. Throughout its more than 30-year history, SOCG has played a seminal role in the formation and evolution of the field, and it continues to serve as the flagship venue for groundbreaking research in all areas of geometric computing. In recent years SOCG has expanded to incorporate CG Week, an event that includes technical sessions with contributed talks, at least two invited talks, a multimedia/video session, satellite workshops, and the Young Researchers Forum, a setting for students and postdocs to present their research. This award will provide travel funding for students and post-doctoral fellows to participate at SOCG and CG Week as well as general support for CG Week activities. Participation by members of underrepresented groups will be encouraged.

POR.DRECONTENT:
SoCG and CG Week in general was a highly successful event. 210 people registered for SoCG. An additional 15 signed up (but were not required to pay registration) for a workshop on the last day, honoring Bernard Chazelle. Of the 210, 107 were young researchers (27 postdoc, 63 PhD, 5 MS, 12 undergrad). 118 participants were from the U.S, and about 60 were from Europe. Specifically, the declared aliations were as follows: 118 USA, 11 Germany, 10 France, 10 Japan, 7 Denmark, 7 Netherlands, 7 Israel, 5 Canada, 4 Austria, 4 Switzerland, 4 Belgium, 3 S. Korea, 3 Australia, 2 Czech Republic, 2 Hungary, 2 Italy, 2 Poland, 2 China, 1.5 India, 1.5 Norway, 1 Spain, 1 Slovenia, 1 Iran, 1 Sweden.

It is estimated that the SoCG-STOC joint-workshop day was attended by 130 SoCG participants, and 170 STOC participants. 

CG Week featured the following academic events:

• 2 invited talks at SoCG:
Daniela Rus (MIT), Jacob Fox (Stanford)

• 61 SoCG paper presentations

• 23 presentations at the Young Researchers Forum

• 9 multimedia demos at SoCG

• 44 talks at the three primary SoCG workshops

• 4 talks at the workshop honoring Bernard Chazelle

• 2 invited talks on the SoCG-STOC joint-workshop day:
Timothy Chan (Waterloo), Santosh Vempala (Georgia Institute of Techology)

• 33 regular talks at the five SoCG-STOC workshops 

 

This NSF grant helped to fund 58 US-based young researchers, and 7 invited speakers at workshops.
